claim: It is hard to get a BLT in Casablanca.

supporting.text: Casablanca is a predominantly Muslim city where pork is not widely consumed, making it difficult to find bacon, a key ingredient in a BLT.

attacks.text: Casablanca is a predominantly Muslim city where pork is not widely consumed, making it difficult to find bacon, a key ingredient in a BLT.
Some international hotels and restaurants in Casablanca cater to tourists and serve pork-based dishes like BLTs.
These establishments are exceptions and not representative of general availability, as they are few and often expensive.
Non-pork alternatives like turkey bacon or beef bacon can be used in BLTs, making them easier to find.
Traditional BLTs require pork bacon, and substitutes significantly alter the taste and authenticity of the dish.

supporting.text: Traditional Moroccan cuisine does not include sandwiches like the BLT, so restaurants may not prioritize offering such items on their menus.

attacks.text: Traditional Moroccan cuisine does not include sandwiches like the BLT, so restaurants may not prioritize offering such items on their menus.
Many international restaurants and hotels in Casablanca cater to tourists and expats, offering Western dishes like BLTs despite local cuisine norms.
Even in international establishments, ingredient availability (e.g., quality bacon or specific bread) may still limit BLT offerings due to supply chain constraints.
Globalization has increased demand for diverse foods in major cities like Casablanca, prompting more restaurants to include BLTs.
Local preferences still dominate commercial decisions; even with globalization, niche items like BLTs may not justify menu space.

supporting.text: Casablanca is a cosmopolitan city with many international restaurants and hotels that cater to tourists and expatriates, increasing the likelihood of finding a BLT.

attacks.text: Casablanca is a cosmopolitan city with many international restaurants and hotels that cater to tourists and expatriates, increasing the likelihood of finding a BLT.
BLTs require bacon, which is not widely available in Casablanca due to Islamic dietary restrictions.
Some high-end restaurants and hotels in Casablanca import bacon to cater to non-Muslim tourists and expatriates.
Even in high-end establishments, bacon is often expensive and inconsistently available due to import restrictions.
The demand for BLTs in Casablanca is low, so even if bacon is available, few restaurants bother to include it on their menus.
Tourist-heavy areas in Casablanca have restaurants that specifically cater to Western tastes, including BLTs.

supporting.text: Globalization has led to the spread of Western fast-food chains in major cities like Casablanca, where BLTs may be available in certain establishments.

attacks.text: Globalization has led to the spread of Western fast-food chains in major cities like Casablanca, where BLTs may be available in certain establishments.
Casablanca's culinary scene remains predominantly Moroccan, with limited availability of Western dishes like BLTs outside tourist-heavy areas.
Even in tourist-heavy areas, Western fast-food chains often adapt menus to local tastes, reducing the likelihood of finding traditional BLTs.
The ingredients for a BLT (bacon, lettuce, tomato) may be culturally or religiously restricted in Casablanca, limiting their availability.
Some high-end hotels or expat-oriented restaurants may import ingredients to serve authentic BLTs, albeit at a premium price.

supporting.text: Local sourcing of ingredients like fresh lettuce and tomatoes may be seasonal, further complicating the availability of a BLT year-round.

attacks.text: Local sourcing of ingredients like fresh lettuce and tomatoes may be seasonal, further complicating the availability of a BLT year-round.
Many restaurants in Casablanca import fresh produce, ensuring year-round availability of lettuce and tomatoes.
Importing produce can be expensive, leading some restaurants to limit BLT availability to reduce costs.
BLTs are not a traditional dish in Casablanca, so demand is low and few restaurants prioritize offering them.
Tourist demand for Western dishes like BLTs is increasing in Casablanca, prompting more restaurants to include them on menus.

supporting.text: High-end supermarkets and specialty stores in Casablanca may import bacon and other ingredients, making it possible to assemble a BLT at home.

attacks.text: High-end supermarkets and specialty stores in Casablanca may import bacon and other ingredients, making it possible to assemble a BLT at home.
Importing bacon is expensive and not widely accessible to the general population in Casablanca.
Even if bacon is imported, finding fresh lettuce and tomatoes of suitable quality for a BLT can be challenging in Casablanca.
Some high-end restaurants in Casablanca may offer BLTs, making it easier for those who can afford dining out.
Cultural preferences in Casablanca may not favor BLTs, reducing demand and availability.
